Hi Tom,

You are right, that was poor copy and paste on my part. Thanks.
i.

> Igor Ranitovic writes:
> 
>>If you think that filtering out URLs that don't look like html pages is good enough for your needs 
>>than you can just simple add URIRegExp exclude filter:
>>^.*(?i)(\\.(bmp|gif|jpe?g|png|tiff|mid|mp2|mp3|mp4|wav|avi|mov|mpeg|ram|rm|smil|wmv|doc|pdf|ppt|swf)$
> 
> 
> Deconstructing this in my minds eye, shouldn't this be:
> 
> ^.*(?i)\.(bmp|gif|jpe?g|png|tiff|mid|mp2|mp3|mp4|wav|avi|mov|mpeg|ram|rm|smil|wmv|doc|pdf|ppt|swf)$
> 
> As it is written in Igor's message the regexp has an unterminated
> group and wants to match a literal '\' instead of a literal '.'.
